subtitleNullable: Examining the Impact of Social Media on Mental Health in West Asia
descriptionNullable: This dataset offers a comprehensive examination of social media usage and its impact on mental health across various countries in West Asia, including Jordan, Kuwait, the United Arab Emirates, and Lebanon. It includes demographic variables such as age group, gender, urban or rural residence, socioeconomic status, education level, and state of residence. Social media habits are detailed, including daily usage hours, most used platforms, and frequency of use. Engagement metrics such as average likes, comments, and shares per post are included, along with the frequency of peer comparison. The dataset also encompasses various mental health indicators, such as social anxiety levels, the impact of social media on body image, sleep quality, self-confidence, experiences of cyberbullying, and general anxiety levels. This rich dataset is invaluable for understanding the intricate relationship between social media behaviors and mental health outcomes in the region, providing insights for developing targeted interventions and support strategies.
title: Social_Media_WestAsia_MentalHealth_Comprehensive
